title: Ruffled Trump Tells ‘Hamilton’ To “Apologize!”; Hollywood, Pundits & Politicos Respond To Pence Boos
text:
President-elect Donald J. Trump wasn’t in the room where it happened but he nevertheless was quick to Tweet his displeasure over Mike Pence ’s raucous reception at Friday night’s performance of Hamilton . The evening was marked by loud boos from audience members when Pence arrived. The show was frequently interrupted by applause for lines in the show that seemed particularly relevant in the wake of the election of Trump and Pence, whose campaign was characterized by overt and covert appeals to white nationalists, Islamophobes, America First isolationists, racists and others in the so-called alt-right movement. The performance at the Richard Rodgers Theatre was capped by a heartfelt, if finger-wagging, speech by Brandon Victor Dixon, who plays Aaron Burr in the hit show. It had been quickly cobbled together by composer/lyricist Lin-Manuel Miranda , director Thomas Kail and current cast members, who learned Friday afternoon that the VP-elect would be attending the sold-out musical.
Here’s video of Dixon’s statement, provided by Team Hamilton and posted on Twitter, followed by responses from the President-elect, Miranda, Dixon, TV’s Kerry Washington and various other politicos, pundits and celebrities. Deadline’s Greg Evans contributed to this report.
